t: 1 Chronicles 16
The Ark Placed in a Tent
And*p they brought in the ark of God and set it inside the tent that David had pitched for it, and they offered burnt offerings and peace offerings before God.
And when David had finished offering the burnt offerings and the peace offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the Lord*s
and distributed to all Israel, both men and women, to each a loaf of bread, a portion of meat, and a cake of raisins.
Then*p he appointed some of the Levites as ministers before the ark of the Lord,*s to invoke, to thank, and to praise the Lord,*s the God of Israel.
Asaph was the chief, and second to him were Zechariah, Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, Obed-edom, and Jeiel, who were to play harps and lyres; Asaph was to sound the cymbals,
and Benaiah and Jahaziel the priests were to blow trumpets regularly before the ark of the covenant of God.
Then on that day David first appointed that thanksgiving be sung to the Lord*s by Asaph and his brothers.
David’s Song of Thanks
Oh*pn give thanks to the Lord;*s call upon his name; make*ld known his deeds among the peoples!
Sing*ln to him, sing praises to him; tell*ld of all his wondrous works!
Glory*ln in his holy name; let*ld the hearts of those who seek the Lord*s rejoice!
Seek*ln the Lord*s and his strength; seek*ld his presence continually!
Remember*ln the wondrous works that he has done, his*ld miracles and the judgments he uttered,
O*ln offspring of Israel his servant, children*ld of Jacob, his chosen ones!
He*pn is the Lord*s our God; his*ld judgments are in all the earth.
Remember*ln his covenant forever, the*ld word that he commanded, for a thousand generations,
the*ln covenant that he made with Abraham, his*ld sworn promise to Isaac,
which*ln he confirmed to Jacob as a statute, to*ld Israel as an everlasting covenant,
saying,*ln “To you I will give the land of Canaan, as*ld your portion for an inheritance.”
When*pn you were few in number, of*ld little account, and sojourners in it,
wandering*ln from nation to nation, from*ld one kingdom to another people,
he*ln allowed no one to oppress them; he*ld rebuked kings on their account,
saying,*ln “Touch not my anointed ones, do*ld my prophets no harm!”
Sing*pn to the Lord,*s all the earth! Tell*ld of his salvation from day to day.
Declare*ln his glory among the nations, his*ld marvelous works among all the peoples!
For*ln great is the Lord,*s and greatly to be praised, and*ld he is to be feared above all gods.
For*ln all the gods of the peoples are worthless idols, but*ld the Lord*s made the heavens.
Splendor*ln and majesty are before him; strength*ld and joy are in his place.
Ascribe*pn to the Lord,*s O families of the peoples, ascribe*ld to the Lord*s glory and strength!
Ascribe*ln to the Lord*s the glory due his name; bring*ld an offering and come before him! Worship*ln the Lord*s in the splendor of holiness;
tremble*ld before him, all the earth; yes,*ld the world is established; it shall never be moved.
Let*ln the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice, and*ld let them say among the nations, “The Lord*s reigns!”
Let*ln the sea roar, and all that fills it; let*ld the field exult, and everything in it!
Then*ln shall the trees of the forest sing for joy before*ld the Lord,*s for he comes to judge the earth.
Oh*ln give thanks to the Lord,*s for he is good; for*ld his steadfast love endures forever!
Say*p also: “Save*pn us, O God of our salvation, and*ld gather and deliver us from among the nations, that*ln we may give thanks to your holy name and*ld glory in your praise.
Blessed*ln be the Lord,*s the God of Israel, from*ld everlasting to everlasting!” Then*p all the people said, “Amen!” and praised the Lord.*s
Worship Before the Ark
So*p David left Asaph and his brothers there before the ark of the covenant of the Lord*s to minister regularly before the ark as each day required,
and also Obed-edom and his sixty-eight brothers, while Obed-edom, the son of Jeduthun, and Hosah were to be gatekeepers.
And he left Zadok the priest and his brothers the priests before the tabernacle of the Lord*s in the high place that was at Gibeon
to offer burnt offerings to the Lord*s on the altar of burnt offering regularly morning and evening, to do all that is written in the Law of the Lord*s that he commanded Israel.
With them were Heman and Jeduthun and the rest of those chosen and expressly named to give thanks to the Lord,*s for his steadfast love endures forever.
Heman and Jeduthun had trumpets and cymbals for the music and instruments for sacred song. The sons of Jeduthun were appointed to the gate.
Then*p all the people departed each to his house, and David went home to bless his household.
